about_the_game:
Take control of a B-17 in a realistic bomber simulator. Destroy key targets by dropping tons of bombs on them.
Command each member of the crew and feel their stress and tension. Take part in the historical campaign across occupied Europe.

Key features:
  • Manage a B-17 crew.
  • Take direct control over every squad member.
  • Destroy targets.
  • Fight enemies.
  • Command an entire bomber squad.



POWERFUL AIRCRAFT, STRONG CREW
Your plane is fully armed and has tons of cargo on board.
However, even the best-armed and equipped plane is nothing without the efficient crew to make up a successful team.
You will be able to sit at the controls as captain or co-pilot and control this powerful machine as well as manage the flight parameters, engine revs, flaps, etc.
In the radio operator's room, you can send and receive reports, study the map, and lead the squadron to its destination.




RETURN HOME
You dropped your bombs, didn't you? The target has been eliminated.
But you're not done yet. To take part in another mission as a commander, you need to return the bomber and crew home. This might be difficult, especially if your machine has been damaged.
You will feel the tension as you watch the aircraft being damaged.
You know that if the plane is finished, so is the crew. However, remember that you have an engineer on the board, so try to be creative and use what you have at hand to solve any issues that arise.




MANAGE THE PLANE
You will have to face more than the anti-aircraft missiles and Messerschmitt squadrons attacking the formation.
Your tasks will include keeping an eye on fuel, ammunition, and bombs.
At high altitudes, you must also pay attention to your oxygen supply. Make sure your crewmates remember to put on their masks.
Sometimes it will be necessary to sacrifice part of your cargo to have enough fuel to reach the airport.
You will have to deal with malfunctions such as a burning engine, broken wheels, a jammed bomb hatch, and others.




NOT A FIRST-CLASS FLIGHT
The flying fortress mission is not a first-class vacation flight. The living conditions of the crew will not be comfortable. There will be constant stress, adrenaline, and the struggle for survival.
Your weapons will help you survive the storms of anti-aircraft missiles and the attacks of enemy fighters.

Additional protection against the enemy will come from maintaining the proper combat box formation. Twelve bombers are posed to be the most difficult target for the enemy. You will be able to manage the entire wing to complete the mission.

Good luck, Captain!
